>
[The Locksmith](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2482)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Stolen Fate</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Artifact" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=253" />
<trait label="Harrow Court" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=496" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #190: The Choosing](/Sources.aspx?ID=198) pg. 78

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** carried

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

_The Locksmith_ represents opening locks, including metaphorical locks such as unlocking fate. As long as you have _The Locksmith_ invested, it grants you a +2 item bonus to [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) checks to [Pick a Lock](/Actions.aspx?ID=70). This increases to a +3 item bonus if you are at least 17th level.

**Activate** <actions string="Reaction" /> envision, Interact;  **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** You would be afflicted by a [curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38) or a [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46);  **Effect** You mimic the turning of a key in a lock and free yourself from your unpleasant fate. You attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) the triggering affliction, using half your level (rounded up) as the counteract level and a counteract check modifier equal to your class DC – 10.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
